reviews.text: The new roof is nice - at least since they fixed its dangerous leaking - but the area where you wait for your train is ugly, dark , dingy, stinks of diesel, and very confusing with poor signage and no easy to find live information on platform. Means it's easy for many people to get the wrong train, as we saw today.

Not too much to do here, but the connections to city trams are very good. This means it is easy to get into the city. I will be forever grateful for staff that let me stay on a train coming here despite the fact I had bought the wrong ticket.

My son who has special needs left his laptop on the concourse and only realised when the train was about to leave so we had to get off the train as he was very upset and the staff in the information centre were very good and very helpful could not do more for us and really put his mind at ease and found his laptop I want to thank them for making his day

Beautiful old building and friendly staff at Manchester Victoria Station. You can reach anywhere in England from here, Lancashire, Yorkshire, Midlands, London, etc and beyond. 

There’s a Costa Coffee and a pub, a few stalls with food vendors and a beautiful memorial of the Manchester Attack in May 2017 (see photo). 

The street circulation around the station has recently changed, so some drivers will have a difficult time to pick up and drop off at be station. Make sure you coordinate with your friends or family if they are coming to get you. 

If you have extra time at the station
take a walk in the surrounding area or shopping district.
It's an easy station to transfer trains on (although lifts are currently out of action) but for a mainline station the facilities are quite lacking
